multiroll package¶

Submodules¶

multiroll.agent module¶

Author: Philipp Rothenhäusler, Stockholm 2020

class multiroll.agent.AgentContainer(ID, agent, debug_is_enabled=None)¶

Bases: multiroll.framework.Utils

Get subset of metrics from flatland environment.

Note:

Defines agent interface to flatland agent.

property current_node¶

Return next node from path or otherwise state.

Warning:

Read-only and an unpopulated path will cause invalid indexing.

edge_container_ids()¶

TODO: Docstring missing and name ambiguous

find_railway_target()¶

Set agents target CoordinateContainer and its admissable states.

Note

Requires the self.railway to be initialised through Graph

get_control()¶
locate()¶

Locate agent in graph and Find next search node.

Note:

If on edge use its path as heuristic.

Note:

This is called only once during the graph generation.

reset_path()¶

Reset path its controller and the AgentStatus.

set_controller(path, controller)¶

Update edge_id and state to control dictionary.

update()¶

Update agent state with flatland environment state.

Note:

Sets the agent.status that coordinates the current_node property access.

multiroll.config module¶

Author: Philipp Rothenhäusler, Stockholm 2020

class multiroll.config.Config(flag_params=<class 'multiroll.config.FlagsDefault'>, visualisation_params=<class 'multiroll.config.VisualisationParamsDefault'>, map_params=<class 'multiroll.config.MapParamsDefault'>, rollout_params=<class 'multiroll.config.RolloutParamsDefault'>)¶

Bases: object

Simple config wrapper to allow programmatic parameter setting.

Supports subclassing and can be extended with JSON (yaml) parsing.

Note:

In order to customise settings in a script subclass the parameters and parse them as argument to the config initialisation.

Numerical parameters are accessed through the dictionary self.params[name] and boolean flags are queried through ConfigInstance.Active(name)

active(flag)¶
parse_args()¶

multiroll.coordinate module¶

Author: Philipp Rothenhäusler, Stockholm 2020

class multiroll.coordinate.CoordinateContainer(ID, coordinate, debug_is_enabled=None)¶

Bases: multiroll.framework.Utils

Create a container of information collected in a coordinate.

Note:

Container to collect and extend information about railway coordinates.

Todo:

Coordinate metrics should be accessible based on States -> e.g. direction based controls

class multiroll.coordinate.StateContainer(state, coordinate_container)¶

Bases: object

Utility class to collect information about state.

Used in global vertices and intersections.

Note:

Allows easy extension and access of state metrics.

Todo:

  • should directly be reference by agent

multiroll.edge module¶

Author: Philipp Rothenhäusler, Stockholm 2020

class multiroll.edge.EdgeContainer(ID, debug_is_enabled=True)¶

Bases: multiroll.framework.Utils

Edge related metrics and occupancy trackers.

add_edges(edges, backward=False)¶

Add edges according to EdgeDirection to dict.

add_states(ingress_states, path, backward=False)¶

Store common path in attribute according to EdgeDirection.

Note:

The ingress states are a dictionary of keys with states that share the same traversability direction and have values with ControlDirection.

get_edges()¶

Return all available edges for this EdgeContainer.

Bases: multiroll.framework.GlobalContainer

Print message if debug_is_enabled is True.

Return global debug mode if no argument provided.

multiroll.framework.set_env(env_arg)¶

Initialise this module with flatland interface.

Note:

This needs to be invoked before any other class usage.

multiroll.graph module¶

Multiagent rollout implemented on flatland environment.

Note:

This module expects to be initialised with the interfacing environment

import graph … graph.Graph(env)

before usage of any subsequently defined classes.

Author: Philipp Rothenhäusler, Stockholm 2020

class multiroll.graph.Graph(env, env_renderer=None, debug_is_enabled=None)¶

Bases: multiroll.framework.Utils

Graph implementation based on networkX.

visualise()¶

Call display utility methods and visualise metrics and states.

Todo:

Add graph visualisation specifics.

multiroll.observation module¶

Author: Philipp Rothenhäusler, Stockholm 2020

class multiroll.observation.PlaceholderObs¶

Bases: flatland.core.env_observation_builder.ObservationBuilder

get(handle: int = 0)¶

Called whenever an observation has to be computed for the env environment, possibly for each agent independently (agent id handle).

handleint, optional

Handle of the agent for which to compute the observation vector.

function

An observation structure, specific to the corresponding environment.

reset()¶

Called after each environment reset.

multiroll.rollout module¶

Author: Philipp Rothenhäusler, Stockholm 2020

class multiroll.rollout.Rollout(rollit=False, prediction_steps=50, *args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: multiroll.simulator.Simulation

Rollout implementation for networkX graph.

controls()¶

Conduct rollout and return the control.

update_agent_states()¶

Update each agent state with most recent flatland states.

Note:

This also updates the agent’s current graph node agent.current_node for the following heuristic algorithm.

multiroll.simulator module¶

Author: Philipp Rothenhäusler, Stockholm 2020

class multiroll.simulator.SimAgentContainer(agent_native)¶

Bases: multiroll.agent.AgentContainer

Container that collects simulation related elements .

get_control()¶

Return control from underlying AgentContainer.

Note:

Meant for deployed real control usage. Not for SimAgentContainer related actions.

reset()¶

Reset agent state to its AgentContainer base.

set_controller(path, controller)¶

Update native AgentContainer with new controller.

update()¶

Update agent state with flatland environment state.

Note:

Sets the agent.status that coordinates the current_node property access.

class multiroll.simulator.Simulation(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: multiroll.heuristic.ShortestPath

Simulator for cost computation along N steps.

simulate_steps(steps)¶

Simulate steps and return total cost.
